Modals

Modals display content in a secondary floating window, allowing users to maintain the context of a primary task while addressing a related action or alert. Modals can be used to force user interaction at a given point in a process, or to simply display information.

Examples

${require('html-loader?interpolate!../../partials/toggles.html')}

Warning Modal

You have selected 20 events to be published. All events will be published to downstream systems outside of MOCI, regardless of their validation status.

You cannot step back this process. 5 of 20 events are past dated.

Warning Modals are unique where they must be initialized differently in order to prevent users from selecting outside of the modal container. Example: $(".example-modal").modal({backdrop: 'static', keyboard: false}). Or, you can pass in the parameters via HTML: data-keyboard="false" data-backdrop="static".

Guidelines

  • Use modals to drive the user to focus on one decision at a time, or when there is a crucial step to be completed before the user can continue.
  • Overuse of modal windows can become overwhelming, so make sure to use them only when necessary. For example, if you are displaying large amount of contents or long forms, it is likely best to create an additional webpage.
  • Modal windows should have a close button, and should close when the user clicks outside the modal window or presses the ESC key.

Documentation

Bootstrap Documentation

Modifiers

Class Description
.uxf-modal-sticky-header add class to .modal element to limit height of modal body and fix header
.modal-sticky-header add class to .modal element to cause modal header to stick on scroll
.modal-scroll-on-add add class to .modal element to cause modal to automatically scroll when content is added dynamically
.modal-open-where-closed add class to .modal element to cause modal to re-open where user previously closed it
.modal-simple add class to .modal-dialog element to apply simple modal styles
.modal-caution add class to .modal-simple element to apply caution modal styles

Javascript

Modals use Bootstrap's modal plugin.

Convert from UXFrame v1 to v2

All Modals
  1. Remove div.modal-spacer
  2. Remove div.layout-inline surrounding the two div.layout-inline-items
  3. Change div .modal to div. modal-dialog
  4. Surround div.modal-dialog with div.modal.fade
  5. Surround div.modal-header content with div.modal-title
Simple Modals
  1. Remove div.caution
  2. Remove div.layout-inline-item surrounding div.modal-confirm-text
  3. Change div .modal-content to div .modal-footer
  4. Change div .modal-mid to div .modal-content
  5. Change div .layout-inline-item.right-align to div .modal-actions
  6. Change .simple-modal to .modal-simple
  7. Change div .modal-confirm-text to div .modal-footer-text
  8. Add .modal-caution to div.modal-simple
Content Modals
  1. Remove div.layoout-inline-item surrounding div.modal-title
  2. Change div .layout-inline-item.right-align to div .modal-actions
  3. Change div .modal-content to div .modal-body
  4. Change div .modal-mid to div .modal-content
  5. Add .modal-lg to the div.modal-dialog element
  6. Add .modal-sticky-header to the div.modal.fade element (if you have a sticky modal header)
